DOC.brief_summary: An electrical-inhibition ( EI ) uterine pacemaker device similar electrical heart pacemaker delivers weak electrical current human uterus active preterm labor rapidly safely inhibit unwanted premature uterine contraction possibly preterm birth .
DOC.brief_title: Electrical Inhibition ( EI ) : A Preliminary Study To Inhibit Preterm Labor And Preterm Birth
DOC.detailed_description: Electrical intervention ( EI ) use bipolar , constant-current ( 1-20 mA ) , square-wave pulse 20 % duty cycle . Women active preterm labor electrode catheter place posterior fornix vaginal canal . The EI current give 80 minute monitor tocodynamometric ( toco ) contraction adjunct electrohysterographic ( EHG ) activity continuously monitor maternal vital sign , fetal heart rate electrocardiogram ( fECG ) . The study include pre-EI control period ( C1 ) ; EI period , 10-second current burst deliver contraction ; post-EI control period ( C2 ) . The whole study take maximum two hour . The uterine toco contraction frequency adjunct EHG electrical activity analyze change cause EI . Changes maternal vital sign , fetal heart rate fECG determine EI side-effects .
DOC.criteria: 24 34 week pregnant singleton gestation ; preterm labor define American College Obstetricians Gynecologists American Academy Pediatrics,78 follow : persistent uterine contraction ( 4 every 20 minute 8 every 60 minute ) And one following : Documented cervical change > 1cm cervical dilatation progress > 80 % cervical effacement anticipate normal spontaneous vaginal delivery ( NSVD ) . least 18 year age sign write Informed Consent Document willing able comply study requirement severe preeclampsia severe abruption placenta rupture amniotic membrane frank chorioamnionitis fetal death fetal anomaly incompatible life severe fetal growth restriction ( EFW < 5 % ) mature fetal lung study maternal cardiac arrhythmia permanent cardiac pacemaker fetal cardiac arrhythmia contraindication tocolysis
